title: Lionel Messi donates £200,000 to youth club in his hometown of Rosario for new football pitch
text:
The Messiah Lionel Messi donates £200,000 to youth club in his hometown of Rosario for new football pitch 
Argentina and Barcelona hero is happy to help the next generation and shelled out money from foundation for kids' facilities By Sam Morgan Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LIONEL MESSI has donated some £200,000 to help recover a football pitch and sports facility in his native Argentina. Lionel Messis donation has given some £200,000 to help kids in Argentina Getty Images 4 Murals to Lionel Messi adorn the walls of buildings throughout Rosario 
And now he has handed over some cash through his foundation to help the next generation of Argentina superstars come through the ranks. 
Mundo Deportivo report the money will go to helping repair the facilities of a sports club in Lanus, in Messi’s hometown of Rosario. 
Damian Sala is secretary of sports in capital Buenos Aires and said: “We are very grateful to the Messi Foundation because it allows us to do great work for the boys. 
“This is a very important achievement because it is the first time that an entity of this size has made a major investment in Lanus.” Getty Images Lionel Messi scored on the pitch on the weekend and helped kids back in his native Argentina Getty Images The Barcelona star is eager to help the next generation of footballers coming through Lionel Messi makes his teammates look like amateurs in Barcelona training Related stories Anthony Martial, Leicester and 'bottlers' Tottenham: Nine things we learnt this weekend TEAM NEWS Which teams are playing, when are they in action and what are their line-ups? Messi's foundation was set up in 2007 and has a special focus on helping children and youths who may be disadvantaged. 
Its activities are not limited to just Argentina and money is donated all over the world.
